comment: Professor Suo is approachable and supportive. He's quick to reply to emails, which is a big help for me. The assignments and projects can be a bit challenging, but the exams aren't too tough. His lectures are clear and easy to follow. It is better to have some Linux experience before you take his class.

Projects are difficult if you are new to using Linux and very little instruction/help is given on them. I (and other students) asked for help with the project and were turned away with no advice and told to "troubleshoot using google". This really hurt my grade as they are worth 40%. Homework and Tests are fairly easy.

Suo is a down-to-business professor. Took him for the summer semester and the pacing wasn't bad. Only  3Hw + 3E for your total grade so stay on top of content. Missing or miserably failing an exam likely fails you so be careful. Overall as long as you don't fall behind and do your hw there's no reason anyone should fail Theory of Computation.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Feedback and support provided on assignments and projects is good. Some of the projects are a little challenging for me. 

Reply to email very quickly. Exams are open-booked which is pretty nice.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Great professor for OS class. Projects and homework are not difficult and gave feedback timely.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Great prof tbh. answers emails and questions in timely manner.

I took CS 3502 Operating System, and the homework and lectures are easy, but the projects need more time and experience with Linux programming. Exam is open-booked but needs to understand the source code.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Great professor, has clear and understandable lectures with homework that supplements your readings. Probably one of my favorite professors in my 5 years at KSU.
Get ready to be attentive in class as Dr. Kun Suo randomly picks anyone in the class and asks them to solve a problem. But all the assignments can be quickly done if you attend his lectures.

The CS4504 was not difficult. We have 4 projects and one paper to present. Overall, the professor gives hints and examples to hands-on and get started. The exams were on D2L and were not difficult if you prepare well. I learned a lot from the course projects, especially programming on Linux.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Class was really easy. It was supposed to be in person, but something happened and it got switched to all online. The coding assignments are a little tricky, but he sets up meeting times during one class day so you can show him your work and get help. He also sometimes posts hints to help people out. He's a super easy grader.

amazing professor. Instead of teaching on how one remembers he approaches teaching in a familiarize the student with the material and share different examples and perspectives. I can actually say I learned in this class compared to other courses where the professor was just reading a ppt no examples etc. 10/10

You are appreciated professor SUO!!

I am taking the CS6041 taught by Prof. Suo. It has 3 exams and 6 homework. The students need to give presentations to review previous topics. The exam is open book and not difficult, but you need to fully understand these topics.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Not a great professor. Makes you explain T/F questions, even though he does not award partial credit. He greatly underestimates the amount of time required to complete his exams. You should expect to spend massive amounts of time watching youtube videos to see examples.
I think Prof. Suo is a great professor and the course is clearly outlined and the project and homework are not difficult to finish. BTW, the lab class is a plus to help us solve the project.

Honestly if you want an easy A or even just a passing grade, this is the Professor to take. I balanced 3 other classes with this course and still managed to get a B in the course. He had a midterm (25%), 3 assignments (15% each) & a final (30%). Hes very accesible and really works with you. Take him! Im a Computer Science Major!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: I think Prof. Suo is a great professor for the most part. I think he really cares if we understand the material, which I found fairly difficult. Had to use a lot of youtube videos to get a better understanding, but his homeworks help a lot for the tests. The 6 HWs are an easy A, tests are graded a bit more harshly. Would take him again.
Definitely would take him again. lectures are really boring but HW is easy, tests are easy, projects are kinda hard but hell work with you. nice guy accent kinda thick but understandable.
Super nice guy and really smart. Class is pretty easy all tests are open note and hw is easy. youll learn a lot if you read ppts and take hw and projects seriously.
